meanings.sent1: The ferreous tools in the workshop were strong and durable.
meanings.sent2: The old gate had a ferreous appearance due to its rusty color.
meanings.sent3: The ferreous pots and pans clanked loudly as they were stacked.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as ferreous as the strongest metal.
meanings.sent5: The ferreous taste of blood filled his mouth after biting his lip.

meanings.definition: Resembling iron in color or properties.
meanings.sent1: The ferreous rocks along the riverbank shone in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The antique mirror had a ferreous frame that added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent3: The ferreous clouds in the sky looked like giant metal sculptures.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a ferreous quality that commanded attention.
meanings.sent5: The ferreous scent of the metal factory filled the air with a metallic tang.
